name: Earth Science
notes: No more than 1.0 credit from ERS399Y5/ERS499Y5/ERS470Y5/ERS471H5/ERS472H5 or JCB487Y5 can be counted toward the Earth Science specialist program.

While students may select any ERS courses for their 2.5 credits at the 300-level or higher, students may choose to take courses from one of the following two pathways for future certification by the Association of Professional Geologists of Ontario in their Geology and Environmental Geoscience oriented streams: Resources, Hazards & Tectonics Pathway: ERS302H5, ERS304H5, ERS402H5, ERS403H5, ERS404H5, ERS425H5, JGE378H5, and 0.5 credits from ERS399Y5/ERS470Y5/ERS471H5/ERS472H5 or JCB487Y5. Earth, Climate & Life Pathway: ERS304H5, ERS312H5, ERS411H5, ERS412H5, ERS425H5, GGR201H5, GGR217H5, and 0.5 credits from ERS399Y5/ERS470Y5/ERS471H5/ERS472H5 or JCB487Y5.
